name: S3Upload
description: Upload file and folder content to an Amazon Simple Storage Service (S3) Bucket
author: Amazon Web Services
helpMarkDown: Please refer to [Working with Amazon S3 Buckets](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/UsingBucket.html) for more information on working with Amazon S3.

inputs.name: awsCredentials
inputs.label: AWS Credentials
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the AWS credentials to use. If needed, click on 'Manage', and add a new Service Endpoint of type 'AWS'.

inputs.name: bucketName
inputs.label: Bucket Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the bucket where the content will be uploaded. If the bucket does not exist it can be created if the 'Create S3 bucket if it does not exist' option is selected below.

inputs.name: sourceFolder
inputs.label: Source Folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: The source folder that the content pattern(s) will be run against. If not set the root of the work area is assumed. You can use [variables](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=550988). Example: $(Agent.BuildDirectory)

inputs.name: globExpressions
inputs.label: Filename Patterns
inputs.helpMarkDown: Glob patterns to select the file and folder content to be uploaded. Supports multiple lines of minimatch patterns.

inputs.name: targetFolder
inputs.label: Target Folder (S3 key prefix)
inputs.helpMarkDown: The target folder (referred to as a key prefix in S3) in the bucket to contain the uploaded content. If not set the root of the bucket is assumed. You can use [variables](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=550988).

inputs.name: filesAcl
inputs.label: Access Control (ACL)
inputs.helpMarkDown: The canned Access Control List (ACL) to apply to the uploaded content. Refer to [Canned ACL](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/acl-overview.html#canned-acl).

inputs.name: createBucket
inputs.label: Create S3 bucket if it does not exist
inputs.helpMarkDown: Attempts to automatically create the S3 bucket if it does not exist.

inputs.name: overwrite
inputs.label: Overwrite
inputs.helpMarkDown: Replace existing files in and beneath the target folder.

inputs.name: flattenFolders
inputs.label: Flatten folders
inputs.helpMarkDown: Flatten the folder structure and copy all files into the specified target folder in the bucket.

inputs.name: contentType
inputs.label: Content Type
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Set a custom content type for the uploaded files.
The task will apply built-in defaults for common file types (html, css, js, image files). This parameter can be used to override the built-in defaults. Note that any value is applied to all files processed by the task.

inputs.name: forcePathStyleAddressing
inputs.label: Force path style addressing
inputs.helpMarkDown:
If enabled path style URLs will be used for S3 objects. The default is off meaning the task will automatically switch between virtual host style addressing and path style addressing depending on whether the bucket name is DNS compatible.

For more information see [Virtual Hosting of Buckets](http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/VirtualHosting.html).

inputs.name: logRequest
inputs.label: Log Request
inputs.helpMarkDown: If selected, request headers and other data for calls to AWS services are logged to the task's debug log.

inputs.name: logResponse
inputs.label: Log Response
inputs.helpMarkDown: If selected, the response metadata and body content of non-streaming responses from calls to AWS services are output to the task's debug log. The unique request ID, which can be useful when contacting AWS for support, is always logged to the task output regardless of this option setting.

messages.UploadingFiles: Uploading files from %s to %s in bucket %s
messages.BucketNotExistNoAutocreate: Bucket %s does not exist or you do not have access. Auto-create option not set, cannot continue.
messages.BucketNotExistCreating: Bucket %s does not appear to exist (or you do not have access). Attempting to create in region %s.
